description.plain:
João Gilberto (10 June 1931, Juazeiro, Brazil — 6 July 2019, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil) was a Brazilian singer, guitarist and composer who was a pioneer of bossa nova (“new trend”) in the late 1950s, along with Tom Jobim and many others.

At the age of 14, Gilberto got his first guitar from his grandfather despite disapproval from his father. Still in Juazeiro he formed his first band, Enamorados do Ritmo, and at the age of 18 began his artistic career as a crooner at the Rádio Sociedade da Bahia. In the 1950s, he went to Rio and was discovered by Tom Jobim, who became impressed with Gilberto’s new style of guitar playing. In 1959, he released the album Chega de Saudade, arranged by Jobim, opening a new path for popular music: bossa nova.

In 1963, Gilberto collaborated with American jazz musician Stan Getz on the album Getz/Gilberto, which became one of the best-selling jazz albums of all time and was awarded with 6 Grammys. Touring around the world, he became one of the most recognized Brazilian artists of his generation.

  


João Gilberto (10 de junho de 1931, Juazeiro, Brasil – 6 de julho de 2019, Rio de Janeiro) foi um cantor, guitarrista e compositor brasileiro, pioneiro da bossa nova no final da década de 1950, como Tom Jobim e outros.

Aos 14 anos, recebeu uma guitarra do avô contra a vontade do seu pai. Ainda em Juazeiro, formou a primeira banda, Enamorados do Ritmo, e aos 18 começou a sua carreira musical como cantor na Rádio Sociedade da Bahia. Nos anos 50, mudou-se para o Rio e foi descoberto por Tom Jobim, que ficou impressionado pela sua nova forma de tocar guitarra. Em 1959, lançou o álbum Chega de Saudade, arranjado por Jobim, abrindo um novo caminho para a música popular brasileira, a bossa nova.

Em 1963, colaborou com o músico de jazz norte-americano Stan Getz no álbum Getz/Gilberto, que se tornou num dos álbuns de bossa nova mais vendidos de sempre e foi galardoado com 6 Grammys. Com concertos por todo o mundo, tornou-se um dos artistas brasileiros mais reconhecidos da sua geração.

songs.title: Corcovado (Quiet Nights of Quiet Stars)
songs.title_with_featured: Corcovado (Quiet Nights of Quiet Stars) (Ft. Antônio Carlos Jobim, Astrud Gilberto & Stan Getz)

description.plain: The song “Corcovado” gains its name from the mountain of Corcovado in Rio de Janeiro, the very same mountain in which the iconic colossal “Christ the Redeemer” statue rests. The song follows the adoration of two singers, who recount their love for each other alongside the surroundings of their corner of Copacabana.

songs.lyrics:
8 ContributorsCorcovado (Quiet Nights of Quiet Stars) Lyrics
Quiet nights of quiet stars
Quiet chords from my guitar
Floating on the silence that surrounds us
Quiet thoughts and quiet dreams
Quiet walks by quiet streams
And a window that looks out on Corcovado
Oh, how lovely

Um cantinho, um violão
Esse amor, uma canção
Pra fazer feliz a quem 'ce ama

Muita calma pra pensar
E ter tempo pra sonhar
Da janela vê-se o Corcovado
O Redentor, que lindo!

Quero a vida sempre assim
Com você perto de mim
Até o apagar da velha chama

E eu que era triste
Descrente desse mundo
Ao encontrar você eu conheci
O que é felicidade, meu amor
You might also like

This is where I want to be
Here with you so close to me
Until the final flicker of life's ember
I who was lost and lonely
Believing life was only
A bitter tragic joke, have found with you
The meaning of existence, oh my love2Embed

songs.title: Desafinado

description.plain:
This song, which literally translates from Portuguese to out of tune, speaks more to the style of music than just the song. When Bossa Nova first originated in the 1960s in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, João Gilberto and Antonio Carlos Jobim, played well known samba tunes, however slower and in an off-key way, therefore originating the extremely popular style of songs like “Girl from Ipanema” and “Bim Bom.” Bossa Nova is a combination of smooth jazz with samba, therefore making it easy to listen to with a bit of twang before un-heard-of. The style, especially this song includes a classical guitar played by hand, versus a pick, and sounds like there is more than one guitar playing due to the complicated chords. The vocals are low and soft, often sounding weak and whispered. This is because of the emphasis on the guitar over the voice, as the voice just becomes a part of the guitar’s tonal layers.

Jobim wrote this song, however it gained popularity with the English version by Stan Getz and Charlie Byrd in 1962. As well Ella Fitzgerald, Frank Sinatra, and Kenny G have covered it. The popular song is a reflection of the genre, instead of just the song, and started the movement into Bossa Nova’s popular streak in the States and Europe.

When Bossa Nova first originated in the 1960s in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, João Gilberto and Antonio Carlos Jobim, played well known samba tunes, however slower and in an off-key way, therefore originating the extremely popular style of songs like “Girl from Ipanema” and “Bim Bom.” Bossa Nova is a combination of smooth jazz with samba, therefore making it easy to listen to with a bit of twang before un-heard-of. The style, especially this song includes a classical guitar played by hand, versus a pick, and sounds like there is more than one guitar playing due to the complicated chords. The vocals are low and soft, often sounding weak and whispered. This is because of the emphasis on the guitar over the voice, as the voice just becomes a part of the guitar’s tonal layers.

Jobim wrote this song, however it gained popularity with the English version by Stan Getz and Charlie Byrd in 1962. As well Ella Fitzgerald, Frank Sinatra, and Kenny G have covered it. The popular song is a reflection of the genre, instead of just the song, and started the movement into Bossa Nova’s popular streak in the States and Europe.

songs.lyrics:
14 ContributorsDesafinado Lyrics
Se você disser que eu desafino, amor
Saiba que isto, em mim, provoca imensa dor
Só privilegiados têm ouvido igual ao seu
Eu possuo apenas o que Deus me deu
Se você insiste em classificar
Meu comportamento de anti-musical
Eu, mesmo mentindo, devo argumentar
Que isto é bossa nova, que isto é muito natural
O que você não sabe nem sequer pressente
É que os desafinados também têm um coração
Fotografei você na minha Rolleiflex
Revelou-se a sua enorme ingratidão
Só não poderá falar assim do meu amor
Este é o maior que você pode encontrar, viu?!
Você com a sua música esqueceu o principal
Que no peito dos desafinados
No fundo do peito, bate calado
No peito dos desafinados também bate um coração

Tumt-tu-dumt-tum-dum-ctum
Tumt-tum-tumt-tu-dum-dumt-tun-tumt
Tumt-tu-dumt-tum-dum-ctum
